source.name: elif efficiency reading question
source.instructions: **Fill in the blanks of the passage below.**
source.text: A series of elif statements can be more efficient that a series of if statements because the <<<elif>>> statements will <<<stop>>> as soon as there is a <<<true>>> boolean expression. The <<<if>>> statement, however, will keep going even if there is a <<<true>>> boolean expression.
source.guidance: A series of elif statements can be more efficient that a series of if statements because the **elif** statements will **stop** as soon as there is a **true** boolean expression. The **if** statement, however, will keep going even if there is a **true** boolean expression.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT understand why elif statements can be more efficient
